review: This was ok, but without HBOGO I can get all of the content on my Kindle Fire.  I sent it back after trying it out for a couple of weeks.  Someone who doesn't have a Kindle Fire or care about accessing HBOGO would probably be more satisfied.
author: Maria E. Jauregui

review: Never having any of the other streaming devices like Netflix, Hulu, etc., we are fairly new to this concept. The device was very easy to hook up and access. We are Prime members. There appears to be a lot of "free" movies to choose from, but it took a while to realize which ones are free and which have a fee; It took awhile to grasp what all the jargin means. It would be nice if there was an online catalog of the free movies, so you can just scroll through the list and choose one. Rather than having to know the name of a movie or choose a lette, and find out if its free before you select it. That's about the most cumbersome feature at this time. If they can improve this, it will be a great device. Another note, people need to be aware that it does use up your internet memory, something we did not even think of, especially if you have other devices like ipads, computers, that you use to streamline thru your WiFi.  Otherwise, it does work well and we really like the concept.
author: livermore chic
